org.cougaar.mts.base
Interface SendLink

All Known Implementing Classes:
MulticastAspect.SendLinkDelegate, SendLinkDelegateImplBase, SendLinkImpl, ZinkyMessageTraceAspect.SendLinkDelegate
public interface SendLink

SendLink is the first station after the MessageTransportService implementation class. Its primary job is to validate the originator and add the message to the SendQueue, thereby ending the call sequence from the caller's point of view (sendMessage).

See Also:
MessageTransportService, SendQueue, Router, DestinationQueue, DestinationLink, MessageWriter, MessageReader, MessageDeliverer, Javadoc contribuions from George Mount.

Method Detail

sendMessage

void sendMessage(AttributedMessage message)
Validates the originator and add the message to the SendQueue, thereby ending the call sequence from the caller's point of view. Invoked from the MessageTransportService impl class method of the same name, which will have already wrapped the original message in an AttributedMessage, using the original message target address's attributes.

Parameters:
message - The AttributedMessage to be sent.
See Also:
SendQueue.sendMessage(AttributedMessage), MessageTransportService.sendMessage(Message)

flushMessages

void flushMessages(java.util.List<Message> messages)
Causes any queued or pending messages from the address associated with the SendLink to be removed from the queues, The list of flushed messages is returned in the supplied ArrayList.

Parameters:
messages - Dropped messages are added to this list.
See Also:
MessageTransportService.flushMessages()

release

void release()
Releases hooks into the MTS and invalidates the SendLink. Called when the MessageTransportService is released by the MessageTransportClient associated with this SendLink.

getAddress

MessageAddress getAddress()
Returns the MessageAddress that this SendLink is associated with.

okToSend

boolean okToSend(AttributedMessage message)
Returns true if it is possible to send message. SendLinkImpl only checks that the target MessageAddress is properly formed and release() has not been called.

Parameters:
message - The message to should be checked for validity.
See Also:
MessageTransportService.sendMessage(Message)

registerClient

void registerClient(MessageTransportClient client)
Calls the MessageTransportRegistry's registerClient, which in turn calls the registerClient for all LinkProtocols. One and only one client should be registered with a SendLink. Once registered, a ReceiveLink is created so that the client can receive messages.

Parameters:
client - The MTS client to register.
See Also:
MessageTransportService.registerClient(MessageTransportClient), MessageTransportRegistryService.registerClient(MessageTransportClient)

unregisterClient

void unregisterClient(MessageTransportClient client)
Unregisters the client from all LinkProtocols. The client should be the client that was previously passed in registerClient. The client will no longer be able to receive messages.

Parameters:
client - The MTS client to unregister.
See Also:
MessageTransportService.unregisterClient(MessageTransportClient), MessageTransportRegistryService.unregisterClient(MessageTransportClient)

getIdentifier

java.lang.String getIdentifier()
Returns the internal name of the Node's MTS. In the current implementation this is just the Node's name, but no assumption should be made that this wll always be true. All SendLinks in a given MTS will always return the same value here.

addressKnown

boolean addressKnown(MessageAddress address)
Returns true iff some LinkProtocol recognizes the given address.

Parameters:
address - MessageAddress whose status is to be determined.
Returns:
true iff one of the registered LinkProtocols knows address.

getAgentState

AgentState getAgentState()
Returns an AgentState that can be used by aspects to store and retrieve MTS-client-based data.
